results.title: Never Too Old
results.brief_description: Never too old is about relationships for the over 60s. Through the use of observational documentary we are introduced to several people who have lost their partners and find that sexual and emotional needs do not necessarily diminish with age. Dave and Betty are the centrepiece of this film. Each had been happily married for more than 35 years, and they are now embarking on a new relationship.

results.title: Never too late
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for the Arts. Film and Television Board
results.brief_description: Discusses the history, scope and functioning of the Manly-Warringah School for Seniors at Dee Why, New South Wales. Emphasises the importance of providing companionship and mental stimulation for the older members of the community.

results.title: Never too late
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: An examination of the opportunities for further education, training and employment for mature-age Aboriginal women. The first part of the program focuses on four women in the Northern Territory, three of whom work as rangers in Kakadu National Park. The program then turns to Sydney to the Murawina Multi-Purpose Aboriginal Education Centre, entirely owned and conducted by Aboriginal women, and dedicated to fostering the further education of Aboriginal women and girls by providing full hostel accommodation and childcare for its students.

results.title: Never tell me never
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, Anne Bruning and David Elfick
results.brief_description: Claudia Karvan stars in the true story of Janine Shepherd, a star athlete and Olympic contender whose dreams were shattered when she became a paraplegic following a tragic car accident. Her recovery will be the biggest challenge to date, far surpassing any athletic feats she has achieved. She is greatly assisted in her recovery by her loving and devoted parents Max (Michael Caton), Shirley (Diane Craig), ‘uncle’ Darryl (John Howard), and surgeon Dr Adrian Cohen (Robert Mammone). From adversity comes joy however, as Janine meets her husband to be, aerobatics pilot Tim Blake (Malcolm Kennard), who shows her the freedom of flight, and eventually Janine not only flies, but learns to walk again too.

results.title: Never give up
results.creator_credit: Haris Fazlic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Haris Fazlic got sick of being larger than his classmates and took up exercising and, eventually, discovered his passion for wrestling. This passion has driven him to win many times despite having to overcome a major obstacle on the way. Wrestling has taught Haris that you should never give up on something you love, no matter what.

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.

results.title: Never cry wolf
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Lewis Allen, Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick and Carroll Ballard
results.brief_description: In the Arctic region wolves are suspected of contributing to the diminishing number of caribou herds. “The Lupine project” is established by the government to investigate and observe wolves to provide concrete evidence of their aggressive nature. A young biologist, Tyler (Charles Martin Tyler), is left alone in the unfriendly Arctic wilderness to conduct such a study where he must contend with the forces of nature to discover as much as he can about the canis lupis; the wolf. Based on Farley Mowat’s autobiographical novel of the same name, screenplay by Curtis Hanson. Also starring Brian Dennehy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Productions, Lewis Allen, Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick and Carroll Ballard

results.title: Never been kissed [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bushwood Pictures, Flower Films, Fox 2000 Pictures, Sandy Isaac, Nancy Juvonen and Raja Gosnell
results.brief_description: In this romantic comedy Drew Barrymore plays Josie Geller, a nerdy self conscious (and at times self-loathing) twenty-five year old who harbours dreams of being swept off her feet by a prince, and falling in love for keeps. In reality she is perennially single and works for a newspaper as a copy editor whilst fostering ambitions to be a reporter. Part of Josie’s dream is realised when she is sent on an undercover assignment - back to high school. Unfortunately for Josie this means a return to the lion’s den - throughout her adolescence Josie was mocked mercilessly and once undercover she soon finds herself drawn back into the nerdy circles in which she is most comfortable. But when her editor demands that she joins the cool group Josie must transform herself or lose the assignment. Much of the humour in this film is quite black - the flashbacks (as well as those scenes in the present) when Josie is humiliated, are quite excruciating to watch. But the many sly intentions of the script are undermined by saccharine overtones that swamp the film. Barrymore however displays a deft talent for comedy, essentially carrying the film, playing a very sympathetic and quite believable teen and young adult.
